title: Volume doesn't gets deleted upon instance termination

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~iamanikeev

comments.content: P.S: Also tried passing a boolean type to the same option, also to no avail. Please let me know, is this a known issue, or a new one, or am I just doing it wrong.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~iamanikeev

comments.content:
Hello,

Typically, volumes persist even after the instance they were attached to is destroyed. I was not aware of delete_on_termination flag. I did some digging around, and I've noticed that this flag is only mentioned by the block_device_mapping_v1 api, but not the block_device_mapping_v2, which you are using [1]. Can you try passing that flag in a block_device_mapping_v1 request?

Finally, the nova-compute services do not delete volumes, something like this would be done by the nova-api / nova-conductor services.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/block_device_mapping.html

Best regards,

Claudiu Belu
